title: How to Choose and Store Kiwifruit

steps.headline: Search through and look for the best looking kiwifruits.
steps.description: Make sure they are not discolored, shriveled, spotted, moldy or oblong. They should be even in color and have a nice round/oval shape.

steps.headline: Feel/gently squeeze the kiwifruit to identify accurate texture.
steps.description: If any of the kiwifruits are hard and do not yield under gentle pressure, put them back. If they yield to gentle pressure but are still firm, keep those.

steps.headline: Get a glass, a normal drinking glass.
Take one half of the kiwifruit and run it down the edge of the glass.
steps.description: Repeat for the other half. This is going empty the flesh of the fruit inside the glass and leave the skin behind.

text: Buying Kiwifruit Search through and look for the best looking kiwifruits. Make sure they are not discolored, shriveled, spotted, moldy or oblong. They should be even in color and have a nice round/oval shape. Feel/gently squeeze the kiwifruit to identify accurate texture. If any of the kiwifruits are hard and do not yield under gentle pressure, put them back. If they yield to gentle pressure but are still firm, keep those. Peeling Kiwifruit Cut the kiwifruit in half.  Get a glass, a normal drinking glass.  Take one half of the kiwifruit and run it down the edge of the glass. Repeat for the other half. This is going empty the flesh of the fruit inside the glass and leave the skin behind.
